raw_response.summary_short: Free-admission local history museum in Golden highlighting the people who built the town, famed local brewing history, and “epic events.” Open Tue–Sat.
raw_response.summary_long: Golden History Museum (Golden History Museums) presents Golden, Colorado’s local history through stories of the “Legendary People” who built the community, the roots of Golden’s well-known breweries, and the town’s “Epic Events.” Admission is always free, making it an easy add-on for a half-day visit focused on place-based history and community identity.

collection_highlights.title: Legendary People who built Golden
collection_highlights.description: Exhibits centered on notable individuals and community builders in Golden’s history.

collection_highlights.title: Golden’s brewing history
collection_highlights.description: Interpretation of why Golden’s local breweries are famous and how brewing shaped the town.

collection_highlights.title: Golden’s Epic Events
collection_highlights.description: Exhibits exploring major events that defined Golden’s local story.

raw_response.best_for: Travelers and locals seeking an accessible, place-based introduction to Golden’s people, brewing heritage, and defining events.

tour_planning_scores.scoring_rationale: Evidence points to a focused local-history experience (people, breweries, events) rather than an encyclopedic collection. Free admission and interpretive exhibits support strong accessibility and educational value for a short visit.
